title: HTML Responsive Web Design
gp1: Responsive web design is about creating web pages that look good on all devices!
gp2: A responsive web design will automatically adjust for different screen sizes and viewports.
gp3: Responsive Web Design is about using HTML and CSS to automatically resize, hide, shrink, or enlarge, a website, to make it look good on all devices (desktops, tablets, and phones):
gp4: To create a responsive website, add the following <meta> tag to all your web pages:
gp5: This will set the viewport of your page, which will give the browser instructions on how to control the page's dimensions and scaling.
gp6: Responsive images are images that scale nicely to fit any browser size.
gp7: If the CSS width property is set to 100%, the image will be responsive and scale up and down:
wp1: The HTML <picture> element allows you to define different images for different browser window sizes.
wp2: Resize the browser window to see how the image below changes depending on the width:
wp3: The text size can be set with a 'vw' unit, which means the 'viewport width'.
wp4: That way the text size will follow the size of the browser window:
wp5: In addition to resize text and images, it is also common to use media queries in responsive web pages.
wp6: With media queries you can define completely different styles for different browser sizes.
wp7: A responsive web page should look good on large desktop screens and on small mobile phones.
